text: ਸਭੁ ਕੋਈ ਚਲਨ ਕਹਤ ਹੈ ਊਹਾਂ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

transliteration.text: sabh kōī chalan kahat hai ūhānh .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਨਾ ਜਾਨਉ ਬੈਕੁੰਠੁ ਹੈ ਕਹਾਂ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: but I do not even know where heaven is. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: nā jānau baikunth hai kahānh .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

text: ਆਪ ਆਪ ਕਾ ਮਰਮੁ ਨ ਜਾਨਾਂ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: One who does not even know the mystery of his own self,

transliteration.text: āp āp kā maram n jānānh .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: speaks of heaven, but it is only talk. ||1||

text: ਜਬ ਲਗੁ ਮਨ ਬੈਕੁੰਠ ਕੀ ਆਸ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: As long as the mortal hopes for heaven,

transliteration.text: jab lag man baikunth kī ās .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: he will not dwell at the Lord's Feet. ||2||

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Heaven is not a fort with moats and ramparts, and walls plastered with mud;

translation.text: I do not know what heaven's gate is like. ||3||

translation.text: Says Kabeer, now what more can I say?

translation.text: The Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy, is heaven itself. ||4||8||16||
